quiz.title: Unit 5: Work & Energy (Quiz 4)
quiz.subtitle: Identifying Work and Energy Changes in Scenarios (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Work Identification and Mechanical Energy Changes

questions.question: The students push on a stationary box to accelerate it across the gym floor. In this situation, work is done on the box by the _
options: The floor pushing upward on the box
The Earth's gravity pulling downward on the box
The box pushing backward on the floor
The students applying force to the box
questions.explanation: The applied push causes displacement; the students do positive work on the box.

questions.question: The students push on a stationary box to accelerate it across the gym floor. As a result, the mechanical energy of the box _
questions.explanation: The box gains kinetic energy while accelerating, so its mechanical energy increases.

questions.question: A person lifts a bucket from the ground to a shelf. In this situation, work is done on the bucket by the _
options: Earth's gravity pulling downward on the bucket
The person's force applied upward to the bucket
The shelf pushing upward on the bucket
The bucket pushing downward on the person
questions.explanation: The lifter's upward force through a vertical displacement does positive work on the bucket.

questions.question: A person lifts a bucket from the ground to a shelf. As a result, the mechanical energy of the bucket _
questions.explanation: The bucket gains gravitational potential energy as height increases.

questions.question: A car slows down on a flat road due to friction. In this situation, work is done on the car by _
options: The friction between the tires and the road
The air resistance opposing the car
The force of gravity pulling downward
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy is removed by friction doing negative work on the car.

questions.question: A car slows down on a flat road due to friction. As a result, the mechanical energy of the car _
questions.explanation: Friction dissipates mechanical energy as heat and sound; KE decreases.

questions.question: A person pushes a box across a rough floor and it slows down due to friction. In this situation, work is done on the box by _
options: The person applying force to the box
The friction between the box and the floor
The gravitational pull on the box
questions.explanation: Friction opposes motion and does negative work on the box.

questions.question: A person pushes a box across a rough floor and it slows down due to friction. As a result, the mechanical energy of the box _
questions.explanation: Mechanical energy decreases as kinetic energy is converted to heat.

questions.question: A rocket is launched into space. In this situation, work is done on the rocket by _
options: The force of gravity pulling downward
The force exerted by the rocket's engine pushing upward
The air resistance opposing the motion
questions.explanation: The engine's thrust through displacement does positive work on the rocket.

questions.question: A rocket is launched into space. As a result, the mechanical energy of the rocket _
questions.explanation: The rocket gains kinetic and gravitational potential energy while ascending.

questions.question: A ball is dropped and gravity pulls it downward as it falls. All the following forces act on it: Gravity (A) and Air resistance (B). Which of the following options is correct about work done?
options: A does positive work and B does negative work
A does negative work and B does positive work
A does positive work and B does positive work
A does negative work and B does negative work
questions.explanation: Gravity acts in the same direction as the motion of the falling ball, so it does positive work. Air resistance acts opposite to motion, doing negative work.

questions.question: A cyclist pedals uphill on a mountain road, overcoming gravitational pull. As a result, the mechanical energy of the cyclist _
questions.explanation: Gains gravitational potential energy as height increases.

questions.question: A person holds a suitcase stationary while standing on the ground. In this situation, work is done on the suitcase by _
options: The person applying force upward to lift the suitcase
The normal force from the floor supporting the suitcase
No work is done on the suitcase
questions.explanation: With no displacement, work on the suitcase is zero.

questions.question: A person holds a suitcase stationary while standing on the ground. As a result, the mechanical energy of the suitcase _
questions.explanation: No change in speed or height, so mechanical energy is unchanged.

questions.question: A ball is dropped and falls toward the ground. In this situation, work is done on the ball by _
options: The floor pushing upward when the ball hits
The air resistance acting on the ball
The person's hand releasing the ball
questions.explanation: Gravity does positive work while the ball falls.

questions.question: A ball is dropped and falls toward the ground. As a result, the mechanical energy of the ball _
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy increases as the ball accelerates downward.

questions.question: A rocket launches and accelerates upward, overcoming gravity. In this situation, work is done on the rocket by _
options: The force of gravity pulling downward
Air resistance acting against the rocket
questions.explanation: Thrust does positive work on the rocket through upward displacement.

questions.question: A rocket launches and accelerates upward, overcoming gravity. As a result, the mechanical energy of the rocket _
questions.explanation: Both kinetic and gravitational potential energy increase during ascent.

questions.question: A student pushes a cart up a ramp, and friction slows it down. In this situation, work is done on the cart by the student pushing the cart, by friction, and by the force of gravity. In this order, how would you describe the work done?
questions.explanation: Work done by the student is positive, as the applied force is in the same direction as motion. Work done by both friction and gravity are negative, since they act opposite to the direction of motion.

questions.question: A student pushes a cart up a ramp, and friction slows it down. As a result, the mechanical energy of the cart _
questions.explanation: Mechanical energy decreases due to energy dissipated by friction.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have a strong grasp of identifying work and energy changes in various scenarios.
scoreMessages.70: Good job! You understand the core concepts but should review work done by multiple forces.
scoreMessages.50: A fair effort. Focus on analyzing the direction of force relative to displacement in different situations.
scoreMessages.0: Keep trying! Review the definition of work (force through displacement) and how it affects mechanical energy.
